short-title.#text:
Promoting Efficiency and Savings
			 in Government Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the
The purposes of this Act are—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to audit the energy performance of buildings owned by the

text.#text: to require the

steps that can be taken to improve energy
			 efficiency and reduce costs; and

cost-savings that can be achieved by
			 implementing energy efficiency measures;

to establish minimum efficiency standards
			 for buildings leased by the Federal government;

to increase energy efficiency and reduce
			 pollution; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the public on the energy use of Federal buildings and the cost-savings and
			 pollution reduction associated with efficiency measures.

text.#text: to require regular reporting to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out an audit of that building
			 that—

text.#text:
Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this
			 Act, each energy manager (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) of a building owned by
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 543(f)(1) of the National
			 Energy Conservation Policy Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Energy Conservation Policy Act/s:543/ss:f/p:1

text.#text:
identifies any
			 modifications necessary to improve energy efficiency that, within 10 years of
			 implementation, will result in energy cost savings equal to the total
			 investment made; and

quantifies the
			 estimated cost-savings associated with any energy efficiency improvements
			 identified by the energy manager.

text.#text: In accordance with

a maximum energy
				intensity standard;

a lighting
				efficiency requirement, accounting for appropriate task lighting; and

to the extent
				feasible, an incentive structure that allows the Federal department or agency
				leasing the building or space and the building owner to share the financial
				savings of efficiency investments and efficient operating practices.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:435/ss:c/p:1

that are designed to improve efficiency in a cost-effective
				manner.

text.#text:

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this
				subsection and every 2 years thereafter, the

the

may be incorporated

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:435/ss:e/p:1

text.#text: A report under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section
			 3307(b) of title 40, United States Code

text.#text:
with respect to
				any prospectus for the construction, alteration, or acquisition of any building
				or space to be leased, an assessment of the future energy performance and water
				efficiency of the building or space, including, to the maximum extent
				practicable—

a description of
				the energy efficient and renewable energy systems, including photovoltaic
				systems, that are likely to be used in the construction, alteration, or
				acquisition of any building or space to be leased;

a description of
				the water saving technologies and systems that are likely to be used in the
				construction, alteration, or acquisition of any building or space to be
				leased;

a description of
				alternative workplace and other related strategies that are likely to be
				employed to minimize the space requirements and energy and water use of the
				building or space;

a description of
				the use of lifecycle cost analysis; and

if applicable, a
				description of any financing methods, such as energy service contracts, that
				are likely to be used for improvements described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 436(f) of the Energy Independence
			 and Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:436/ss:f

header.#text:

			 building energy and water efficiency

cost savings
				attributable to energy and water efficiency measures; and

a description of
				the use of design or technological features that contribute to reductions in
				energy and water use, as determined to be appropriate for inclusion by the
				Federal Director; and
